channel.title: RSPS Programmers/Coders Needed
channel.description:
This has been a long coming idea of mine for quite some time now, but up until recently I did not have the means to set it into motion. After a few months, I've acquired the correct resources to make this happen; now I just need a team.
I have been wanting to start a successful RSPS. I played around with some 317's back a few years ago and really enjoyed creating an environment where players could relax and enjoy a game. What I am asking of the moparscape community is it to start from a clean base, whatever source and generation we choose and make it as successful to RS as possible. I have the knowledge to add small snippets and tutorials, but never really got good at it. My skills lie more in the hardware and software spectrum of computers.
[b]What I am offering:[/b] I will handle all hosting related manners. I will be running the server testing from my own computer until the time for public release when I will buy a top of the range VPS. I have business class internet with reliable, consistent 76\19 speed. I will handle the upkeep, my partners would be responsible for weekly updates if possible. I am familiar with registering domains. I will need some help with building a website as well as forums for the game. In this area, I would like a developer who is capable of linking the forum user database with the users from the server. I do have an allowed budget for this product, and I do have income. When the server gains popularity, I will split the profits fairly. I am not looking for a get cash quick scheme, I am genuinely looking to start a successful community. You will also all receive Admin permissions on server and forums.
I will be available to my team almost 24/7 and will distribute my mobile number to them after things have been finalized.
I am in full time employment. I do not have time to learn how to develop a server, and am just looking for a team to handle server and client side of things. An example would be to implement a webclient.
If you have the skills for the job, but don't like the terms, contact me anyway. It can't hurt to talk and see if we can work something out.
Aside from experience, the only trait I'm looking for is maturity, and possibly age.
Please contact me via Skype: King.Lxa
Thanks.

item.title: RSPS Programmers/Coders Needed
item.dc:creator: @LumbysChild LumbysChild
item.description:
@LumbysChild wrote:

This has been a long coming idea of mine for quite some time now, but up until recently I did not have the means to set it into motion. After a few months, I’ve acquired the correct resources to make this happen; now I just need a team.

I have been wanting to start a successful RSPS. I played around with some 317’s back a few years ago and really enjoyed creating an environment where players could relax and enjoy a game. What I am asking of the moparscape community is it to start from a clean base, whatever source and generation we choose and make it as successful to RS as possible. I have the knowledge to add small snippets and tutorials, but never really got good at it. My skills lie more in the hardware and software spectrum of computers.

What I am offering:
I will handle all hosting related manners. I will be running the server testing from my own computer until the time for public release when I will buy a top of the range VPS.
I have business class internet with reliable, consistent 76\19 speed. I will handle the upkeep, my partners would be responsible for weekly updates if possible.
I am familiar with registering domains. I will need some help with building a website as well as forums for the game. In this area, I would like a developer who is capable of linking the forum user database with the users from the server.
I do have an allowed budget for this product, and I do have income.
When the server gains popularity, I will split the profits fairly. I am not looking for a get cash quick scheme, I am genuinely looking to start a successful community. You will also all receive Admin permissions on server and forums.

I will be available to my team almost 24/7 and will distribute my mobile number to them after things have been finalized.

I am in full time employment. I do not have time to learn how to develop a server, and am just looking for a team to handle server and client side of things. An example would be to implement a webclient.

If you have the skills for the job, but don’t like the terms, contact me anyway. It can’t hurt to talk and see if we can work something out.

Aside from experience, the only trait I’m looking for is maturity, and possibly age.

Please contact me via Skype: King.Lxa

Thanks.
